On 2/24/06, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> C=E9dric,
>
> Do=
esn't the fact that you name the Exception parameter ignore (or
> expected,=

> or ...) communicate this intent? Is it a checkstyle thing that forces yo=
u
> to
> put the comment in as well?


Sure.  Redundancy doesn't hurt, but =
ideally, you could use the comment to
explain why it's safe to ignore this =
particular exception.  Swallowing
exceptions can lead to very painful debug=
ging sessions, so it's worth taking
some time to explain why your reviewer =
shouldn't worry.

--
C=E9dric
